section.title: receiving entering of receipts Enter Receipt
section.para: To receive Orders into Inventory, select the "Enter Receipt" option. The following screen will appear:
When receiving an Order, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the Order Number of the Purchase Order, Transfer Order or Sales Return whose Line Item(s) you want to receive into Inventory. The browse button located to the right of the field leads to a searchable list of Purchase Orders available for receiving. This option will be disabled if a Transfer Order is specified.

varlistentry.term: Assign all Lot Controlled Items to single Lot #

listitem.para: Select if you want all the Lot-controlled Items in a Receiving session to be assigned the same Lot Number. Lot Numbers are assigned when Receipt(s) are posted. This option applies to Lot-controlled Items only. There is no impact on received Items which are not Lot-controlled. For perishable Items, you will also be given the opportunity to enter an expiration date. Expiration dates apply only to Item Sites marked as perishable.
Display lists Order Line Items available for receipt confirmation.

tip.para: Before a Purchase Order can be received successfully, A/P Account Assignments for the specified Vendor must be in place.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without entering a Receipt, returning you to the application desktop.
Select to print the paperwork associated with the specified Order.
Select this button to post the Receipt quantity to Inventory.
Select this button to save the Receipt quantity for posting at a later time. Saved Receipts may be posted later from the List Unposted Receipts screen.

Highlight a Line Item, then select this button to reach the Receipt detail screen. Double-clicking on a Line Item will also bring you to the Receipt entry screen. This option will be disabled if a Transfer Order is specified.
Select to receive all Line Items simultaneously.

note.para:
If the Item you are receiving is a multiple location control impact on receiving
receiving MLC impact on Multiple Location Control (MLC) Item, you will be prompted to specify the Location you want to distribute the stock to.
